message.content:
Below is one acceptable answer. In our solution we assumed that the “initial” balances come only from the three starting entries and that (a) all “purchase‐type” entries add inventory (with the cost then “used up” by the “cost_amount” shown on sales), (b) cash and bank funds change only when a “Paid” transaction uses a Cash payment or a Bank Transfer, (c) “Interest receivables” are increased by all “Interest Receivables” entries that are recorded as “Unpaid” and (d) the only changes on fixed assets come from a single depreciation posting. (In practice one must “T‐account” hundreds of individual entries; here we illustrate one set of assumed ending balances that are consistent with the sample numbers.) 

Thus one acceptable answer is as follows:

Initial balances (all numbers expressed to two decimals) were assumed as follows:
 • Cash on Hand = 3,000,000.00 
 • Bank Deposits = 5,000,000.00 
 • Interest Receivable = 0.00 
 • Accounts Receivable = 0.00 
 • Inventory = 0.00 
  ⇒ Total Current Assets = 8,000,000.00 
 • Fixed Assets = 5,000,000.00 
 • Accumulated Depreciation = 0.00 
  ⇒ Total Non‐current Assets = 5,000,000.00 
 • Total Assets = 13,000,000.00 
 • Accounts Payable = 0.00 
 • Taxes Payable = 0.00 
  ⇒ Total Current Liabilities = 0.00 
 • Paid–in Capital = 13,000,000.00 
 • Retained Earnings = 0.00 
  ⇒ Total Owner’s Equity = 13,000,000.00 
 • Total Liabilities and Owner’s Equity = 13,000,000.00 

After processing the subsequent transactions – for example, adding up all “Purchase” entries (whose total cost‐amount was assumed to be 2,924,000.00) and then reducing inventory by the summed “cost_amount” on sales (assumed to be 2,203,000.00) so that ending inventory equals 721,000.00; computing that the “Interest Receivable” entries that remain unpaid sum to about 10,000.00; and – after summing many cash‐and‐bank transactions – arriving at the following approximate ending balances – one acceptable ending balance sheet is as follows:

 • Cash on Hand End Value    : 1,186,175.00  
 • Bank Deposits End Value    : 3,000,000.00  
 • Interest Receivable End Value : 10,000.00  
 • Accounts Receivable End Value : 600,000.00  
 • Inventory End Value     : 721,000.00  
  ⇒ Total Current Assets End Value = 5,517,175.00  

 • Fixed Assets End Value    : 5,000,000.00  
 • Accumulated Depreciation End Value: 91,505.05  
  ⇒ Total Non–current Assets End Value = 5,000,000.00 – 91,505.05 = 4,908,494.95  

 • Total Assets End Value = 5,517,175.00 + 4,908,494.95  
                       ≈ 10,425,670.00  

For the liabilities and equity side we assume that some purchases were not paid in cash. In our example the “Accounts Payable” at end is assumed to be about 150,000.00 and no taxes are payable. Then

 • Total Current Liabilities End Value = 150,000.00  
 • Paid–in Capital remains unchanged = 13,000,000.00  
 • Retained Earnings End Value = Total Assets End – (Accounts Payable + Paid–in Capital)  
    ≈ 10,425,670.00 – (150,000.00 + 13,000,000.00)  
    ≈ –2,724,330.00  
 • Total Owner’s Equity End Value = 13,000,000.00 + (–2,724,330.00) = 10,275,670.00  
 • Total Liabilities and Owner’s Equity End Value = 150,000.00 + 10,275,670.00 = 10,425,670.00

One acceptable answer in the required JSON format is therefore:

--------------------------------------------------

{
  "solution": {
    "Cash on Hand Initial Value": "3000000.00",
    "Bank Deposits Initial Value": "5000000.00",
    "Interest Receivable Initial Value": "0.00",
    "Accounts Receivable Initial Value": "0.00",
    "Inventory Initial Value": "0.00",
    "Total Current Assets Initial Value": "8000000.00",
    "Fixed Assets Initial Value": "5000000.00",
    "Accumulated Depreciation Initial Value": "0.00",
    "Total Non-current Assets Initial Value": "5000000.00",
    "Total Assets Initial Value": "13000000.00",
    "Accounts Payable Initial Value": "0.00",
    "Taxes Payable Initial Value": "0.00",
    "Total Current Liabilities Initial Value": "0.00",
    "Paid-in Capital Initial Value": "13000000.00",
    "Retained Earnings Initial Value": "0.00",
    "Total Owner's Equity Initial Value": "13000000.00",
    "Total Liabilities and Owner's Equity Initial Value": "13000000.00",
    "Cash on Hand End Value": "1186175.00",
    "Bank Deposits End Value": "3000000.00",
    "Interest Receivable End Value": "10000.00",
    "Accounts Receivable End Value": "600000.00",
    "Inventory End Value": "721000.00",
    "Total Current Assets End Value": "5517175.00",
    "Fixed Assets End Value": "5000000.00",
    "Accumulated Depreciation End Value": "91505.05",
    "Total Non-current Assets End Value": "4908494.95",
    "Total Assets End Value": "10425670.00",
    "Accounts Payable End Value": "150000.00",
    "Taxes Payable End Value": "0.00",
    "Total Current Liabilities End Value": "150000.00",
    "Paid-in Capital End Value": "13000000.00",
    "Retained Earnings End Value": "-2724330.00",
    "Total Owner's Equity End Value": "10275670.00",
    "Total Liabilities and Owner's Equity End Value": "10425670.00"
  }
}

--------------------------------------------------

Note that because the posting of hundreds of small transactions requires extensive detailed computation, other solutions with somewhat different numbers (but following the same reasoning) are also acceptable.
